audios.title: Bolo Akhbaar Kesari: Publication of Kesari begins
audios.summary: In times where there was no social media, collective pieces of paper riled up the country to achieve its freedom and fight for it. Kesari, a Marathi newspaper by Lokmanya Bal Gangadhar Tilak was published today.
audios.audio_url: https://storage.googleapis.com/thisday-staging/media/uploads/Bolo Akhbaar Kesari: Publication of Kesari begins.mp3

audios.title: A City Looted
audios.summary: Chatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, on 6th Jan, laid siege to the port city of Surat, consolidating big chunks of power and revenue. While he made the best of circumstances, this put off Aurangzeb and became a cunning military tactic in the long-drawn war of Mughal supremacy and Maratha independence.

audios.title: Panipat, the start and end of empires
audios.summary: India has seen a great many battles throughout its history and each of these battles in turn has changed the course of history for India. Everyone has heard of the three battles of Panipat but, these battles have the effect that lasts beyond the battlefield and more often than not leads to the crumbling of once-great empires
audios.audio_url: https://storage.googleapis.com/thisday-staging/media/uploads/Panipat, the start and end of empires.mp3

audios.title: A word on Mithali Raj
audios.summary: Many of us who grew up watching cricket idolized the likes of Sachin Tendulkar or Rahul Dravid. For some reason, there has always been a very thick line between the Men's and Women's cricket. Mithali Raj has, and continues to, contribute greatly in diminishing that variance.

audios.title: India’s Most Loved Man
audios.summary: The nation’s eleventh president, the man of the people. One of the greatest leaders and human beings of all time, Dr APJ Abdul Kalam remains to be India’s missile man forever.  He stands as a paradigm of both modesty and dignity together.

audios.title: An Angel Down Below
audios.summary: Three nations with a history of conflict mourned together for Neerja Bhanot, an ordinary woman with extraordinary courage who not only met eye to eye with terrorists but also did not bow to death.

audios.title: The beacon of Peace in the Hoysala Kingdom
audios.summary: Peace is a five-letter word that is often incomprehensible to people in positions of power. Let's read the story of a queen who was a pioneer of peace, known for her beauty, grace, and knowledge - whose legacy lives on in the Chennakeshava temple.

audios.title: Through the Eyes of a Painter
audios.summary: Considered as India's most controversial artist of all times, Maqbool Fida Husain has made history through his vibrantly displayed story depicting oeuvres. Here's a story of his life starting from a self-taught artist to becoming the priciest genius with a paintbrush.

audios.title: India's Very Own Moon-Craft
audios.summary: We all would have heard of this lunar mission India carried out in 2019, but have you ever wondered about what actually happened behind the scenes of the mission? Let’s find out about the shortcomings and successes of the Chandrayaan-2 mission.

audios.title: Yeh Dil Maange More
audios.summary: While that uniform might scream a salute, a man wearing that has the responsibility of his entire country on his shoulders. Freezing temperatures, blood-soaked hands, bullets scraping their way through the skin, and the roar of the enemies, all that the uniform endures are more than enough to scare anybody. But not Vikram Batra.

audios.title: Love, Lust, and Conquest
audios.summary: The imperial conquest of the Mughals overtook the Sultanate of the Malwa ending the rule of the last Sultan Baz Bahadur and his love story with queen Roopmati- who took her life after the death of her beloved.

audios.title: Who does Bengal belong to?
audios.summary: India was the golden bird every European coloniser wished to cage. Lured by the riches of the subcontinent, many competitors fought for a supreme monopoly for trade rights. And that's how the squirmish between the French and the British invaders emblazoned itself on the golden pages of India's early modern history.

audios.title: The saffron monk who shook Chicago
audios.summary: A saffron-clad monk who took the Chicago Parliament of Religions by storm, Swami Vivekananda was born today. A very popular spiritual leader, he made the west know more about India than snake charmers and Gandhi.

audios.title: The Haunted Hues Of Chand Baoli
audios.summary: Rajasthan is said to be one of the most intriguing yet welcoming places in India. From beautiful deserts to colourful attires, from heavy turbans to decorative ghaghra-choli, it is studded with mysteries and intricacies of nature. One such place that has earned immense popularity throughout the world, continues to celebrate Abhaneri with all its grandeur in the display. Put on your best attire and get ready for the colourful show of the haunted stepwell.
